intro: Pavonia ekmanii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill pavonia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands. It has compound leaves with oval to lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. Pavonia ekmanii is a rare species, often growing in specific microhabitats with limited distribution.
